Author: TonyL#3577
Content: This sharding stuff - seems they are build the roads with gasoil cars - now have traffic jams and need more roads. While assetchains it's a traffic of flying cars where cars fly on the different levels

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they want to build a single road to handle all traffic

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Our cars can fly in parallel - can take all the  air square because no need roads

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a city did that, there would be a single highway that is a glorified parking lot

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in komodo, we just build more normal roads

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and yes to combine traffic from multiple roads requires a bit of extra work, but that is much better than trying to shard the main highway

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: There is some basic traffic safety rules as dPOW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is possible to make a vacuum sealed maglev train that can go very fast

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you cant use rockets, the gases mess up the vacuum, so it needs to be electric

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and likely such a high tech "road" would have a higher througput than a normal road

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but at 1000x the cost

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: better to have 1000 normal roads than a single maglev highway, which will be expensive to use

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in fees and time, and please ignore the TB of data

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: On some point tech should evaluate organically to such super roads. Like a when 1Mb memory in PC was a super high tech - it was possible to make a 1 Gig cluster but needed 1000 of 1Mb instances

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: But it's not very cost-effective and real usage oriented to build such PC

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Better to have many ones which can fit a everyday tasks of current technologies state

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i like practical solutions, they are much more useful

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: @jl777c thx that was very informative :)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just because everybody else is working on the wrong problem to solve, doesnt mean that komodo solution isnt valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i just cant see a non-centralizing way a single chain can scale up in usage. you end up with TB chains needed GB/sec bandwidth, so really other than massive data centers you need to use lite wallets, ie. centralized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the komodo solution is the most decentralized possible solution to this problem. the fact that it isnt some theoretically pure solution isnt relevant when all the alternatives require unscrambling an omelet into the original eggs or TB +GB/sec centralized monsters that force lite wallets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont compare to some fantasy ideal case when there are ZERO other scalable solutions

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Sorry to change subject.

I have a scenario I'd like some direction on plz:
1.  There are two addresses: Rxyz1 & Rxyz2
2.  The blockchain is currently at block 10,000
3.  I would like to create a rule where Rxyz1 can only send to Rxyz2 when the height is at 10,9XX.
4.  In fact I am happy for Rxyz1 to send to Rxyz2 anytime in the blockchain life it is 100 blocks before the next thousand.  e.g. 11,9XX, 12,9XX, ... ... 505,9XX 

What is the best way?

5.  Instead of 505,9XX can we use a method similar to "time based sapling activation" that says 100 blocks after 9am UTC the transaction will be valid.
6.  Can we make transactions valid between set hours, e.g. 9am-5pm

?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the heir CC is similar to this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you have a designated pubkey as heir

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you then have a special address that you can spend freely at any time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the heir can only spend if you dont do any spends for a specified amount of blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you could setup a similar CC where there are constraints on when a specific pubkey is allowed to spend, how much, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this CC does not exist, but CC are turing complete -> anything you can write a program for can be implemented

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the answer to the question of whether a CC can do X? is the same as the answer to the question "is it possible to write code that does X"

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Yes thanks, using CC makes it easier to achieve said goal than have to do some other "cryptic stuff" üòÉ   thanks!
